ginRummy
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  ginRummy.Game

 class Game
extends java.lang.Object

Game is the main class to simulate a Gin Rummy card game of up to 4 players. The game has a text based user interface for a fully interactive game, all players can see all other players' hands.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ben Francis and Sam Black
See Also:
Pile

public Game()

Method Detail

Deal

public int Deal(Deck deck)
Prompts the user for a number of players and then adds 7 Cards to each player's Hand.

Parameters:
deck - A shuffled deck of cards to be dealt
Returns:
0 upon successful dealing of cards.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Creates a new game of Gin Rummy and plays the game

See Also:
Play()

Play

public void Play()
Plays the game of Gin Rummy. Iterates through each player (until someone wins) and allows them to choose to pick up a Card from the discard Pile or a card from the Deck. Then lets them choose which card to put down. Once the end of the deck is reached, moves the cards in the discard pile to the deck, shuffles it and puts the top card of the deck on the discard pile. After each turn, checks to see if the current player's hand is a winning hand.
